apple pie: a crust made of pastry dough
sugar and spices sprinkled on top
a lattice top made of pastry dough
baby back ribs: the ribs are small and delicate
they are usually cooked with sauce
they are often served with sides like corn on the cob or potato salad
they can be eaten with your hands
they are usually served on a plate or platter
baklava: a sweet pastry made of layers of filo dough filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup or honey
the top layer of dough is often decorated with patterns
baklava is cut into small pieces and served as a dessert
beef carpaccio: a garnish of fresh parsley or basil leaves
beet salad: a mix of red and green leaves
small, round, red or purple beets
other vegetables like onions, carrots, or radishes
bread pudding: bread pudding is usually brown or tan in color
it is often served with a sauce or topping, such as whipped cream or caramel
breakfast burrito: filled with eggs, cheese, and meat
served with salsa, guacamole, or sour cream
bruschetta: a piece of bread that has been grilled or toasted
topped with olive oil, garlic, tomatoes, and other vegetables
served as an appetizer or main dish
caesar salad: a mix of greens and other vegetables
cannoli: a creamy filling, often made with ricotta cheese
chocolate chips or candied fruit on top
carrot cake: a cake with a carrot-shaped top
a cake with carrots on the top and sides
a cake with a frosting made to look like carrots
a cake with a green frosting made to look like carrot tops
cheese plate: a plate with several different kinds of cheese
a variety of crackers or bread
a knife for cutting the cheese
a spreader for spreading the cheese
cheesecake: a cheesecake is typically round or rectangular in shape
is usually topped with fruit, whipped cream, or chocolate
the crust is usually made from graham crackers, cookies, or pastry
chicken curry: a pot or pan with a curry-like sauce
rice or noodles on the side
spices and herbs sprinkled on top
chicken wings: chicken wings are usually fried and have a crispy skin
they are often served with a dipping sauce
they are usually eaten with the hands
they can be plain or have a variety of flavors
chocolate cake: a chocolate cake is typically brown or dark brown in color
it is often decorated with chocolate chips, frosting, or other toppings
it has a moist, dense texture
it is often served with ice cream or whipped cream
chocolate mousse: a chocolate mousse is typically a dark brown or black color
it is a smooth, creamy texture
it is often served in a glass or cup
it may have whipped cream or other toppings on it
clam chowder: a thick, creamy soup with chunks of potatoes, onions, and celery
a garnish of parsley or other herbs
club sandwich: two or three slices of bread
toothpicks or skewers to hold the sandwich together
crab cakes: a crab cakes is usually two small, round patties
made of crab meat, bread crumbs, and seasonings
served with a dipping sauce or remoulade
may be garnished with lemon wedges, parsley, or other herbs
creme brulee: a ramekin or other small, oven-safe dish
a torch for caramelizing the top (optional)
croque madame: a toasted sandwich with cheese and ham
served with a side of salad or fries
dumplings: small, round, and filled with meat or vegetables
escargots: can be a variety of colors, including white, brown, and black
falafel: made from ground chickpeas, fava beans, or both
usually served in a pita or wrap
topped with salads, pickles, and sauces
filet mignon: a cut of beef that is tender and lean
usually has a small amount of fat around the edges
can be grilled, pan-fried, or roasted
is a popular choice for a steak dinner
fish and chips: a large, rectangular piece of fish
a small, rectangular piece of chips
a small amount of oil or grease
foie gras: a light pink or tan color
frozen yogurt: a cup or cone of frozen yogurt
toppings such as fruit, nuts, or candy
garlic bread: a long, thin loaf of bread
sliced lengthwise and spread with garlic butter
often topped with garlic cloves and/or parsley
gnocchi: small, round, and usually white or pale in color
can be made from potatoes, flour, semolina, or ricotta
often served with sauce or vegetables
greek salad: a mix of greens, such as lettuce, spinach, and arugula
grilled cheese sandwich: two slices of bread, usually white or wheat
one or more cheese slices, typically American, Swiss, or cheddar
grilled salmon: the salmon is cooked when it is opaque and flakey
the salmon should be grilled on both sides
there may be grill marks on the salmon
the salmon is often served with lemon wedges and dill
hamburger: lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, cheese, and/or other toppings
hot dog: toppings such as ketchup, mustard, or relish
hummus: a light brown or tan color
a slightly nutty or earthy flavor
a slightly tangy or acidic taste
a slightly sweet or savory taste
a slightly spicy or peppery taste
lasagna: multiple layers of pasta, sauce, and cheese
macaroni and cheese: a bowl or dish of macaroni noodles
yellow, orange, or white in color
may have toppings like bread crumbs or bacon
macarons: often decorated with a design on top
miso soup: a light brown or tan color
chunks of tofu, seaweed, and/or vegetables
mussels: a muscular foot for clinging to surfaces
gills for extracting oxygen from water
nachos: with various toppings such as diced tomatoes, onions, peppers, and jalapeños
served with a side of salsa or guacamole
omelette: a cooked egg white and yolk
fillings such as cheese, ham, or vegetables
onion rings: a breading or batter around the onion
a dipping sauce on the side
served as a side dish or appetizer
paella: a variety of cooked meats and vegetables
pancakes: each pancake is round and flat
there is syrup or butter on top of the pancakes
the pancakes are usually served with fruit, bacon, or sausage
pho: a stand or mount to support the screen
input ports for connecting to other devices
pizza: toppings, such as cheese, pepperoni, or vegetables
sauce, such as tomato or Alfredo
pork chop: a pork chop is typically a rectangular or oval-shaped cut of meat
it is usually pink or white in color
it has a layer of fat on one side
it is often served with a bone in the center
poutine: a stand or mount to support the screen
input ports for connecting to other devices
pulled pork sandwich: a sandwich with a filling of pulled pork
bread that is soft and white
ramen: a protein (chicken, beef, pork, shrimp, etc.)
a broth (chicken, beef, pork, shrimp, etc.)
seasonings (soy sauce, chili pepper, ginger, etc.)
ravioli: a filling of meat, cheese, or vegetables
a sauce, such as marinara or Alfredo
a fork or spoon for eating
red velvet cake: often decorated with red velvet cake crumbs
samosa: filled with a savory filling such as spiced potatoes, onions, peas, or meat
often accompanied by dipping sauces such as chutney or yogurt
shrimp and grits: a bowl or plate of food
sushi: sushi is usually served on a small, oval-shaped plate
sushi is typically made with white rice, fish, and vegetables
sushi is often garnished with wasabi, pickled ginger, and soy sauce
tacos: a soft or hard taco shell
fillings such as meat, cheese, lettuce, and tomatoes
a sauce such as salsa or sour cream
takoyaki: a small, round ball of batter
a piece of octopus in the center
served with a sauce and/or toppings
